seng202.group6.controller

Class AddEditController<T extends Record>

  • java.lang.Object
    • seng202.group6.controller.AddEditController<T>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AddEditAirline, AddEditAirport, AddEditRoute

    public abstract class AddEditController<T extends Record>
extends java.lang.Object
    Controller for the add edit window. Can operate in two mode: add and edit. Add creates a new record, while edit edits and existing record.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private javafx.scene.control.Button buttonCancel 
      protected javafx.css.PseudoClass errorClass
      Used to make the text fields' appearances change to indicate invalid contents.
      protected T recordUnderEdit
      The record being edited, or null if we are creating a new record
      protected RecordList<T> sourceList
      The list to add the record to.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AddEditController() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected abstract void addRecord()
      Creates a new record using the data in the editor and adds it to the source list.
      protected abstract void applyEdit()
      Applies the changes in the data to the record under edit.
      private void close()
      Closes the window.
      private void confirm()
      Called by the confirm button.
      private void displayAlertInvalid()
      Displays an alert outlining that the operation cannot proceed because of invalid data.

      JavaFX initialization method.
      protected abstract void populateFields()
      Populates the edit fields with the currently stored data.
      void setUp(RecordList<T> sourceList, java.lang.Integer index)
      Sets the mode and data.
      protected abstract boolean validate()
      Checks that every field in the editor is valid.

    • Method Detail

      • close

        private void close()
        Closes the window.

      • confirm

        private void confirm()
        Called by the confirm button. Checks that all fields are valid and if so applies the edit or creates a new record as appropriate.

      • setUp

        public void setUp(RecordList<T> sourceList,
                  java.lang.Integer index)
        Sets the mode and data.
        Parameters:
        sourceList - the list the record to be edited may be found in or the list to append the new record to
        index - the index in the source list of the record to edit, or null to indicate add mode

      • displayAlertInvalid

        private void displayAlertInvalid()
        Displays an alert outlining that the operation cannot proceed because of invalid data.

      • populateFields

        protected abstract void populateFields()
        Populates the edit fields with the currently stored data.

      • applyEdit

        protected abstract void applyEdit()
        Applies the changes in the data to the record under edit.

      • addRecord

        protected abstract void addRecord()
        Creates a new record using the data in the editor and adds it to the source list.

      • validate

        protected abstract boolean validate()
        Checks that every field in the editor is valid.
        Returns:
        true if every field is valid else false.

      • initialize

        protected abstract void initialize()
        JavaFX initialization method. Adds a listener to the text property of each text fields for validation, and triggers an initial validation check on each field.
